intro: Anemopaegma floridum, commonly known as the Florida anemone, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, and it relies on insects for pollination. Anemopaegma floridum is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand periodic flooding.
